subject: History
title: Knights and the Code of Chivalry
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Knights and the Code of Chivalry.

hook.text: Knights in shining armor fighting for honor is mostly fiction. Real knights were armored tax collectors.

buildup.text: A knight's armor and horse cost as much as a modern luxury car. Only the wealthy could afford knighthood.

discovery.text: Chivalry was invented partly to control violent knights. The Church wanted warriors with a moral code.

twist.text: In practice, chivalry mainly applied to other nobles. Peasants, women, and enemies often received brutality.

climax.text: Tournaments started as lethal training exercises. They evolved into spectacles that bankrupted families.

punchline.text: Chivalry was PR for professional violence.

quiz.question: Why was the code of chivalry created?
options: To give knights a path to royal succession
To impose a moral code on violent warriors
To establish international rules of warfare
